dlgLine.text: Of all the lousy planes on that rotten airfield, I just had to go and choose you, didn't I...
You there - I don't suppose you have a spare crankshaft or valve guide on you?

dlgAnsw.text: Is this your plane?
Are you a pilot?
No, I don't. Is that important?

dlgLine.text: Yes and no. I don't suppose you have an airplane do you?

dlgAnsw.text: I don't have an airplane.
I don't have an airplane - yet.
What's wrong with that one?
I'll ask the questions here.

dlgLine.text: Among other things. You wouldn't happen to have an airplane would you?

dlgAnsw.text: Sorry.
If I found one, could you fly us out of here?
In a hurry?

dlgLine.text: Not if you have an airplane.

dlgAnsw.text: Sorry.
If I found one, could you fly us out of here?
In a hurry?

dlgLine.text: Helicopter? Jet fighter? Gyrocopter? Flying wing? Look, pretty much anything that can get airborne will do.

dlgAnsw.text: Sorry.
If I found one, could you fly us out of here?
In a hurry?

dlgLine.text: It is, as they say in Mozambique, thoroughly fucked. Not quite my color either. Have you seen any around here?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Oh, good... Coming from these parts, I'm guessing it's going to be along the lines of 'you done seen that squirrel over yonder?'

dlgAnsw.text: I'm not from around here.
What's that supposed to mean?
You're not from around here?

dlgLine.text: Of course not. That would make my life less shit. Okay, well, have a nice life then.

dlgAnsw.text: If I found one, could you fly us out of here?
In a hurry?

dlgLine.text: Can I fly you out? Yes. Can you afford to have me fly you out? Probably not.
I'm sure you've got a lovely bunch of huddled masses yearning to be free of this charming realm of incest and truck nuts, but I don't do heroics or charity, sorry.

dlgAnsw.text: You want money? How much?
Maybe we can make a deal.
People's lives are at stake and you're just walking away?
How about this - come fly for us or I'll kill you right here.

dlgLine.text: No, I love waiting around to be ambushed by rotting corpses and sunbaked yokels. Why would I ever want to leave this blessed, steak-fried paradise?

dlgAnsw.text: We have a shelter, not far from here. We could use a pilot.
If I found a plane, could you fly us out of here?
I need a pilot, so you're going to help us.
Good luck with that.

dlgLine.text: Good for you.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Oh, I'm sorry - duhhhhh, pardner. That more your speed, champ?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Do I smell of barbecue and lubed-up pig? No.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Now, unless you can tell me where I can find a vehicle that will get me airborne, I think we've exhausted our topics of discussion.

dlgAnsw.text: We have a shelter, not far from here. We could use a pilot.
If I found a plane, could you fly us out of here?
I need a pilot, so you're going to help us.
Good luck with that.

dlgLine.text: I bet. Are you going to pay me with kindness? A big suitcase full of smiles? No, I think I'd rather take my chances on my own, thanks.

dlgAnsw.text: You want money? How much?
Maybe we can make a deal.
People's lives are at stake and you're just walking away?
How about this - come fly for us or I'll kill you right here.

dlgLine.text: Am I? Is some charming ragtag bunch of unwashed moppets going to sing a song that will make my heart swell ten sizes this day? No, see, I've got skills, and those skills aren't cheap.

dlgAnsw.text: You want money? How much?
Maybe we can make a deal.
People's lives are at stake and you're just walking away?
How about this - come fly for us or I'll kill you right here.

dlgLine.text: Oh, trust me, there's no amount of bad luck that could get me to stay in this miserable backwater any longer than I have to.

dlgAnsw.text: This area is pretty dangerous. You could stay at our shelter until you plan your next move.
Now that I think about it, I could really use a pilot.
Oh, before I go - hand over your valuables. Please.
I won't keep you anymore. So long.

dlgLine.text: Money... Heh... What the hell am I going to do with money these day? Wipe my ass?

No, my friend, food is the new gold standard. And, being a seasoned pro in the fine art of putting my ass on the line for financial gain, I've got to warn you, I don't even get out of bed unless it smells like Christmas dinner.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you want?
I'm not going to pay you to come live at our shelter!
How about this - come back with me and I let you live?

dlgLine.text: You want to make a deal? Okay, knowing quality when you see it is a definite plus in any potential employer - big checkmark for that. But, I have a standard clause for all my jobs lately.

dlgAnsw.text: Of course.
Let's hear it.

dlgLine.text: Life is cheap, people like me are expensive. You want the best pilot your supplies can buy, you hire me. You want a saint, I suggest you start checking dashboards over in little Mexico.

dlgAnsw.text: What kind of price are you talking about?
You think life is cheap - how about I end yours if you don't fly for us?
Sorry - I can't justify that, not when I have people to feed.

dlgLine.text: You'll what? <Laughs> Let's think about this, shall we? I walk away - you have no pilot. You kill me - you have no pilot. You piss me off - you have no pilot! Do you see how this works?
Now, are you serious about needing a pilot or does someone have to wave their dick in the air before we can proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: Fine... Let's talk business.
I'm going. And you can go fuck yourself.
Why don't you just hand over your valuables and we'll call it even.
Live pilot, dead pilot - I don't even have a plane! <Attack>

dlgLine.text: No.
And yes, I have been threated at gunpoint before, so draw your own conclusions from that.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay... I'll go.
I can't say this about everyone - but you really deserve this. <Attack>
Hope you have a bulletproof spine, motherfucker! <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Quite generous - but I'm afraid my skills are in high demand these days. No, I've got to find a client or keep moving.

dlgAnsw.text: I could use a pilot...
I'll be on my way. So long.

dlgLine.text: Think about it this way - for a few cans of food here or there, you have yourself a pilot on retainer. Get your hands on a plane or helicopter and I could take you or your people out of here whenever you wanted. That's a damn fine bargain in these troubled times.

dlgAnsw.text: What would you want from me?
Think about this - you fly for us or you die here.
Not interested. So long.

dlgLine.text: Here are my terms – first, I pilot any aircraft you need me to. Anything beyond that, it's going to cost you extra.
Second, I'll assist you in all flight-related preparations, but until it's time to take to the skies, I sit pretty up in our safehouse where the chances of death are much, much slimmer.
Third, the terms of this agreement can change any time. If that doesn’t sit right with you, well, I invite you to fill your vacancy elsewhere.

dlgAnsw.text: I can do that.
Oh, c'mon - you can't be serious.
Let's be reasonable... can you be flexible on one of those?
Hell no. Go fuck yourself.

dlgLine.text: Then you've got yourself a pilot. Just don't think about screwing me on the deal and we'll have a long and uncomplicated partnership.

dlgAnsw.text: Not planning on it. What's your name?
Got a name?

dlgLine.text: What? I'm practically pimping myself out here. Well, whatever - you're not interested, you're not interested.
I'm sure you'll be able to figure out the basic principles of flight when those dead people start swarming your chopper.

dlgAnsw.text: Good point. Okay, I'll agree to your terms.
I'll agree for now... let's call it a trial period.
Pass. No one's getting more than anyone else.

dlgLine.text: How about I throw in a bonus. When I was looking for an airfield, I noticed several interesting buildings and marked them on a map. Interesting stuff. That info is yours, should you commit to my employment.

dlgAnsw.text: Deal.
I think I'll pass.

dlgLine.text: Fair enough.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Your loss. Me - I plan on being out of this hellhole by nightfall, plane or not. Good luck and all that.

dlgAnsw.text: Whatever it is you want - I'll do it. I need a pilot.
Not worth it. I'm out of here.

dlgLine.text: How about... McCroskey. Lloyd McCroskey - yeah, that'll do. Now - why don't we leave this piece of shit jet to rot with the rest of them and head back to your place. I don't know about you, but I could use a nice, big meal.

dlgAnsw.text: Follow me.
You better be a damn good pilot.

dlgLine.text: You're still here.

dlgAnsw.text: Whatever it is you want - I'll do it. I need a pilot.
I just came back to tell you you're a dick. Now I'm going.
